title: Customer Sales Service till ALSO
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad person som vill arbeta i en supporterande och administrativ roll med breda sociala kontaktytor och samarbeten? Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i Customer Sales Serviceteamet på internationella ALSO!
 



  

**Företag :**
 ALSO Sweden AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Kundtjänst
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 40h/v
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 ALSO verkar inom teknologisektorn och distribuerar varor och tjänster inom IT och Teknik till några av Nordens största IT-bolag. De befinner sig just nu på en spännande tillväxtresa och växer kontinuerligt med nya kollegor. Företaget sitter i fräscha, ljusa lokaler i Kista. Du kommer att tillhöra Customer Sales Services och arbeta tillsammans med 15 kollegor varav 3 kollegor i samma roll.
 


  


 Customer Sales Services är en intern såväl extern stödfunktion. Som medarbetare i teamet är man företagets ansikte utåt och arbetar med breda kontaktytor – både internt och externt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett långsiktigt arbete på ett spännande, modernt och växande bolag med högt i tak och familjär stämning
  
* En öppen kultur med engagerade och hjälpsamma kollegor i blandade åldrar
  
* Arbetet är förlagt på ALSOs kontor i Kista men med viss möjlighet till distansarbete
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ta emot inkommande samtal och mail, bland annat besvara på leveransfrågor
  
* Utringande telefonsamtal i samband med aktivitet
  
* Säljarbete i tät relation med vår säljavdelning
  
* Löpande orderläggning i SAP och bevakning av backlog samt administration däromkring
  
* Hantera omfakturering/kreditering
  
* Kundprofiler i webshop
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl i tal som i skrift
  
* Har erfarenhet från ett serviceyrke med kundrelationer och/eller administrativ erfarenhet
  
* Är nyfiken och har lätt att lära och förstå nya saker
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**
 erfarenhet av försäljning, förståelse av IT-branschen samt erfarenhet i SAP.
 


  


 I den här rollen kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och din motivation för tjänsten. Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Du har en positiv inställning, en nyfikenhet och driv att lära dig och för att förstå helheten i ditt arbete. Vi tror att du är en person som sprider energi och värnar om relationen till dina kollegor på kontoret.
 


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Augusti
  
* Uppdrag: Långsiktigt, initialt sex månader med ambition till förlängning eller överrekrytering därefter såvida alla parter är nöjda
  
* Placering: Kista
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**ALSO Sweden AB**

 Läs mer om ALSO här!
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Lizette Wiedel eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105298

title: Systemtekniker tillika förvaltningsledare IT-arbetsplats till Rättsmedicinalverket
description:
*På Rättsmedicinalverket (RMV) har du möjlighet att utöva din profession samtidigt som du tillsammans med dina kollegor bidrar med svar i rättskedjan och att skapa ett rättssäkert samhälle.*
 Är du en erfaren systemtekniker inom klient och IT-arbetsplats som önskar axla en roll som är operativ i den dagliga driften samt taktisk i att omfatta en säkerställd leverans av en stabil klientmiljö för våra användare? Detta i samarbete med andra förvaltningsledare inom områden som IT-infrastruktur och våra olika verksamhetssystem. Du förväntas ansvara för planering och förvaltning och tillsammans med leverantörer och organisation skapa en modern och stabil IT-arbetsplats. Vill du även vara en viktig del av rättskedjan och bidra i It- och digitaliseringsenhetens arbete med att stödja verksamheten? I så fall är det dig vi söker.
   

  

 It- och digitaliseringsenheten ingår i myndighetens huvudkontor, som är placerat centralt i Stockholm, och ansvarar för IT-drift, IT-förvaltning och IT-utveckling där en prioriterad del i arbetet är att öka takten i digitaliseringsarbetet. RMV genomför nu flera utvecklingsinsatser och utökar då även organisationen för IT och digitalisering.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 IT-arbetsplatsen är viktig för trivsel och arbetsmiljö, den är även viktig för ett effektivt arbetssätt. RMV har IT-arbetsplatser i olika typer av miljöer, i labbmiljöer såväl som i helt vanliga kontorsmiljöer. RMV:s förvaltningsmodell, baserad på PM3, är ditt stöd som förvaltningsledare IT-arbetsplats. I din roll blir du en viktig del i att fånga upp verksamhetens behov, livscykelhantera vår teknik, samt omvärldsbevaka. Vidare ingår i rollen att ha dialog med leverantörer kring kostnadseffektiva lösningar, ge underlag för beslut och delta i budgetarbete. I förvaltningsledarrollen kommer du samarbeta med övriga förvaltningsledare för att skapa en helhet.
   

  

 Som erfaren systemtekniker är du en del i den dagliga driften tillsammans med övriga tekniker i driftgruppen och bidrar med din kompetens i att lösa dagliga driftuppgifter samt vidareutveckla vår IT-miljö. I dina uppgifter ingår:
   

  

* daglig IT-drift och förvaltning
* att säkerställa tillgänglighet
* att fånga krav och önskemål från verksamheten och vara en länk mot IT-leverantörer
* att prioritera inom ramen för förvaltningsplan
* statusrapportering till objektägare IT
* att föredra ärenden för objektägare IT
* att bidra i licenshantering och budgetunderlag för IT-arbetsplats
* tekniskt inköpsstöd till verksamheten
* logistikhantering och avstämning med leverantörer
* att formulera rapporter och förslag till förändringar som föredras inför beslut av It- och digitaliseringsenhetens ledningsgrupp.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Du har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning med inriktning mot IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig.
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av operativt arbete med klienter, klientkonfiguration och kringutrustning.
* Erfarenhet av att analysera ändringar, dess beroenden samt bedöma risk.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Windows OS.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i SCCM.
* Goda kunskaper inom Active Directory.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Utbildning i eller erfarenhet av PM3.
* Erfarenhet av produkt- och tjänstedialog med leverantörer.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla tjänsteutbud.
* Erfarenhet av att paketera IT-tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av telefoni och telefonitjänster i större organisationer.


**Personliga egenskaper och förmågor**
 Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper, eftersom interna kontakter är en viktig del i arbetet. Vi ser därför att har god samarbetsförmåga, är flexibel och kommunicerar på ett tydligt sätt. Du arbetar strukturerat och planerar och driver dina arbetsuppgifter framåt och håller tidsramar. Vidare är du pedagogisk och serviceinriktad och säkerställer resultat bland annat genom att följa upp dina arbetsuppgifter och ärenden. Du tar ledningen i arbetsgrupper inom ramen för ditt mandat och skapar engagemang via ditt förhållningssätt.
   

  

**Anställningen** 
 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, som inleds med sex månaders provanställning, med placering i Stockholm, alternativt Linköping. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Det finns utifrån verksamhetens behov möjlighet att teckna enskild överenskommelse om distansarbete del av arbetstid. Då myndighetens enheter finns på olika orter i Sverige, kan resor i tjänsten förekomma.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsprocess och det kan förekomma arbetspsykologiska tester, kunskapsprov eller arbetsprov. I vissa av våra rekryteringar genomförs en bakgrundskontroll. I samband med anställning vid Rättsmedicinalverket följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

**Vill du också vara med och bidra till ett rättssäkert samhälle?**
 Välkommen med
 **din ansökan senast den 25 augusti.** 
 Betyg och övriga handlingar tas med vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 Rättsmedicinalverket värnar om en rekrytering fri från diskriminering och strävar efter att ge lika möjligheter för alla.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Mikael Dellsand, tfn 072-228 68 59. Fackliga företrädare för Saco är Maritha Torkildsen Nilsson, tfn 010-483 41 27, för OFR/ST Selma El Hadi, tfn 010-483 46 34 och för Seko Christer Johansson, tfn 010-483 46 24.
   

  

 Ta gärna del av våra förmåner:
   

  

 https://www.rmv.se/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/att-jobba-pa-rattsmedicinalverket/formaner-hos-oss/
   

  

 Vi är den medicinska länken i rättskedjan. Här jobbar rättsläkare, utredare, rättsmedicinska assistenter, biomedicinska analytiker, administratörer och många fler på uppdrag av bland andra polis, åklagare och domstol.
   

  

 Här kan du möta några av våra medarbetare:
   

  

 https://www.rmv.se/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/vara-medarbetare/

title: Technical Project Manager/Coordinator, Advanced Vizualisation
description:
**Job Title**
 Technical Project Manager/Coordinator, Advanced Vizualisation
   

  

**Job Description**
 In this role you will manage the deployment and upgrade to meet customers' satisfaction of IT solutions for our large-scale customers in Nordics. This position will also give you the opportunity to deploy and support IT solutions such as Advanced visualization (AV) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) for radiology, offered by the Philips Health IT division.
   

  

**Your main tasks as Project coordinator:**
* Coordinate and lead IT solutions deployment projects within hospitals according to guidelines, in order to achieve objectives and meet customer’s expectations.
* Manage change and adoption of new software after deployment.
* Ensure compliance with deadlines and budgetary requirements specified in the project.
* Participate in project retrospectives to determine areas for future improvement.


**Your main tasks as technical consultant:**
* Install and configure CI IT solutions: Advanced visualization (AV) application server, Artificial Intelligence (AI).
* Perform software upgrades in version upgrade.
* Realize remote support of solutions; managing customers’ calls and act to fix issues.
* Validate the prerequisites and deploy the technical solutions in accordance with the project schedule.
* Validation of the solutions proposed in pre-sales. Provide solutions to customers in the event of specific requests.
* Provide detailed technical documents for configurations and settings.
* You are the guarantor of the passage into production on the technical level of the installed solutions.
* Share users’ feedbacks, points of improvement and correction of the system with the Quality and Development teams.
* Review customers’ feedbacks to make recommendations for engineering changes, if any.
* Participate in projects retrospectives to determine areas for future improvement.


**You are part of t** 
 he Enterprise Informatics Operation team - you will join a dedicated Clinical informatics team of project managers, and you will work closely with the teams of technical and application consultants and interact with the sales teams.
   

  

 You will interact with healthcare professionals mainly in Radiology as well as with hospitals' IT departments to integrate our AV/AI solution into the hospitals' clinical workflow.
   

  

 This role will require travel through Nordics and some EMEA countries -
   

  

 30% travel to be expected.
   

  

**Your strengths to succeed in this position.**
* Bachelor's, Master's or Engineering degree in Computer Science.
* Min 2 years of experience in IT deployment and/or IT support (ideally in a hospital setting).
* Excellent communication skills, IT skills, team spirit, interpersonal skills and pedagogy to provide the best service to our customers.
* Strong client, solution and result orientation.
* Fluent English and Swedish mandatory, additional Nordic languages would be a plus.
* Good skills in IT trouble shooting, logs analysis correlated to solution usages.
* Capacity to travel and a clean full driving license.


**Please send your CV in English.**
**In return, we offer you the opportunity** 
 to be a player in hospitals’ transformation in EMEA in order to continuously improve the quality of care provided to patients. You will evolve in a reactive work environment where your decisions will have a real impact on the understanding of our solutions and the patients’ journey at the hospital.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Forskningsingenjör
description:
**Vill du bidra till medicinsk forskning av toppkvalitet?**
 Institutionen för medicinsk epidemiologi och biostatistik bedriver forskning inom epidemiologi och biostatistik inom ett brett spektrum av områden inom biomedicinsk vetenskap. Institutionen är bland de största inom sitt område i Europa och har särskilt starka forskningsprofiler inom psykiatrisk, cancer-, reproduktiv, pediatrisk, farmakologisk, genetisk och geriatrisk epidemiologi, ätstörningar, precisionsmedicin, och biostatistik.
   

  

 En del av framgången för institutionen beror på vår samarbetsanda, där en stor bidragande faktor är att forskare vid institutionen delar och samfinansierar gemensamma resurser (som t.ex. IT och en tillämpad biostatistikgrupp). Institutionen ligger på campus Solna. Mer information finns på http://ki.se/meb.
   

  

 På Institutionen för Medicinsk epidemiologi och biostatistik (MEB), Karolinska Institutet, pågår flertalet prospektiva kliniska studier inom cancer. Cancergenomik-teamet på MEB ansvarar för prospektiv analys av patientmaterial från dessa kliniska studier. Dessa omfattar >50 sjukhus i sex europeiska länder. De två största prövningarna är ProBio-studien (www.probiotrial.org) och ALASCCA-studien (https://ki.se/mmk/alascca-studien). Teamet leds av den seniora forskaren Johan Lindberg och ingår i en större forskningsmiljö (~25 personer) under ledning av professor Henrik Grönberg. ALASCCA-studien är ett samarbete mellan Anna Martlings forskargrupp (Institutionen för molekylär medicin och kirurgi (MMK), KI) och Henrik Grönbergs forskargrupp (MEB, KI).
   

  

**Din roll**
 Varje vecka skickas prover till KI biobank för de prospektiva kliniska prövningarna. Dessa prover behöver tas om hand och förberedas för DNA-sekvensering i vårt genomik-labb. Vi söker en ordningsam person för veckovis hantering av olika typer av vävnader med målet att utföra avancerad DNA-analys.
   

  

 I tjänsten som forskningsingenjör ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* DNA-extraktion från plasma, FFPE-vävnad, helblod samt färskfrusen vävnad.
* Preparation av DNA-bibliotek för sekvensering på ett Illumina sekvenseringsinstrument.
* Att utföra anrikning på DNA-biblioteket av valda regioner i det humana genomet mha så kallad ”in solution hybridisation based capture”.
* Noggrann rapportering av de löpande resultaten från det veckovisa arbetet enligt ett protokoll.
* Optimeringar av våra nuvarande protokoll. Vi söker ständigt att förbättra de assays samt bioinformatiska mjukvaror som används i teamet
* Att processa retrospektiva prover från insamlat patientmaterial.


**Vem är du?**
**Ingångskrav**
* Master of science i relevant ämnesområdet samt med åtminstone fem års erfarenhet av labbande.
* Muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på engelska är ett krav då arbetsmiljön är internationell.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbetsuppgifterna 1) - 4) ovan.
* Erfarenhet av att optimerat assays tex PCR eller ddPCR.
* Erfarenhet av enkel dataanalys i tex. R-studio för utvärdering av resultat från labb.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i ett ackrediterat labb.
* Erfarenhet av att etablera ackreditering för ett labb.
* Doktorstitel förutsatt att arbetet omfattade optimering av assays tex PCR eller ddPCR.


 För att lyckas i miljön måste kandidaten ha förmågan att arbeta självständigt, att samarbeta, vara ambitiös och ta initiativ. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Du kommer att lära dig laborativa processer för att utföra avancerad DNA-analys. Du kommer att arbeta i ett team av labbingenjörer, bioinformatiker samt akademisk personal. Miljön är kreativ och uppmuntrar vidareutveckling för att säkerställa din framtida attraktionskraft på arbetsmarknaden.
   

  

 Utöver det erbjuder Karolinska Institutet en kreativ, internationell och inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Vår vision är att driva utvecklingen av kunskap om livet och verka för en bättre hälsa för alla. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal. Medarbetare på KI erbjuds också möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Det innebär att om den verksamhet du jobbar i tillåter, så kan du arbeta en del av din arbetstid på distans. Du får även träna fritt i våra moderna friskvårdsanläggningar där utbildad personal finns på plats.
   

  

*Tio skäl att välja Karolinska Institutet*
**Placering:** 
*Solna*
**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi. I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället att få svara på några frågor om varför du söker jobbet.
   

  

 Vid tillsvidareanställning tillämpar Karolinska Institutet 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-2884/2024 | Kontakt: Johan Lindberg johan.lindberg@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Henry Wölling, SEKO henry.wolling@ki.se, Ann Almqvist, SACO ann.almqvist@ki.se, Niklas Andersson, OFR niklas.andersson@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2024-07-05 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-02

title: Project Manager
description:
Gillar du utmaningar och att leda samarbete med olika intressenter för att säkerställa framgångsrika projekt? Får du energi av att leda projektteam och leverera utmärkta lösningar och tjänster till kunder? Då kan detta vara tjänsten för dig. SD Worx söker en affärsdriven projektledare för att leda implementationsprojekt.
 



**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker en erfaren projektledare till vårt team i Sverige. Du är proaktiv, organiserad och flexibel, med starka ledarskaps- och kommunikationsförmågor. Du gillar utmaningar och har en passion för att driva projekt.
 



**Ansvarsområden** 



* Leda implementationsprojekt med kunder
* Hantera tvärfunktionella projektteam och säkerställa projektframgång
* Kommunicera med styrgrupper
* Säkerställa att projekt levereras enligt tidplan, budget och kvalitetskrav
* Samarbeta med säljteamet och delta i säljprocessen vid behov
* Bidra till förbättring av vår metodik och processer för bästa kundupplevelse



**Din bakgrund** 



* Erfarenhet av att leda projekt mot kunder, gärna från konsultverksamhet
* Starka projektledaregenskaper och förtroendeingivande personlighet
* Effektiv och inkluderande kommunikatör
* Van vid komplexa projektmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av HRIT-projekt (HCM, lön och liknande system) är meriterande



**Krav** 



* Minst 5+ års erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT och konsultverksamhet
* Akademisk examen, troligtvis Civilekonom eller liknande
* Starka ledarskaps-, samarbets- och kommunikationsfärdigheter
* Positiv och entusiastisk attityd
* Förmåga att hantera flera projekt samtidigt
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Certifiering inom projektledning (PPS, PMI eller motsvarande) är meriterande
* Resmöjlighet vid behov



 Tjänsten är på heltid med placering i Sundbyberg, Norrköping eller Göteborg. SD Worx har en hybridarbetsstrategi.
 



 För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Annika Mattfolk, Chef Projektledning, via kontaktuppgifterna på sidan. Skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande.

title: Operations Specialist - Platform Quality
description:
**Job Description**
 As an Operations Specialist in the Platform Quality team, you will take a pivotal role in maintaining and enhancing the quality of our platform operations. Your primary focus will be on conducting in-depth data analysis, implementing strategic initiatives, and driving continuous improvement projects to ensure exceptional partner performance and satisfaction. This position requires a highly analytical, detail-oriented professional with strong project management capabilities and excellent interpersonal skills who thrives in a dynamic, high-growth environment.
   

  

* Lead comprehensive quality and satisfaction audits to ensure our partners consistently meet the highest service standards.
* Develop and implement data-driven strategies to identify performance trends and optimize partner performance.
* Engage proactively with regional operations and local restaurant teams to identify opportunities for performance enhancement and process improvements.
* Conduct advanced data analysis to draw insights and make informed strategic decisions.
* Create detailed reports and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators and track the impact of implemented initiatives.
* Identify and implement process enhancements to streamline operations, increase efficiency, and improve partner satisfaction.
* Lead development projects aimed at refining operational processes and integrating new technologies.


**Our humble expectations**
* +2 years of experience in operations, data analysis, account management, or a similar role, with a focus on quality assurance and performance optimization.
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques; experience with Google Sheets, Looker, or other data applications is advantageous.
* Proven track record of implementing data-driven strategies to improve performance and quality.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to lead projects, influence, and collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
* Highly detail-oriented, organized, and capable of managing multiple complex projects simultaneously.
* Self-motivated with a proactive approach to problem-solving and a passion for continuous improvement.
* Strong communication skills, with fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.
* Based in Sweden, Norway, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Finland, Denmark, Iceland, or Luxembourg.


**Next Steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea, Talent Acquisition Partner:
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications coming through email** 
 due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page!
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

***Join us today to build Wolt together.***

title: Administrativ ekonomiassistent
description:
**Administrativ ekonomiassistent till DevCode Group AB** 




  





 Är du en engagerad och noggrann administrativ ekonomiassistent som funderar över vad som händer efter sommaren? Kan DevCode vara din nästa arbetsplats? ☀️
 



  





 DevCode Group är det lilla bolaget med cirka 60 anställda, men samtidigt ett företag med breda möjligheter. Vi stoltserar med de allra vassaste IT-konsulterna, i kombination med drivna innovativa entreprenörer. En mix som inte bara skapar spännande möjligheter, utan även erbjuder trygghet när marknaderna svajar. Totalt omsätter bolagen som vi startat (inklusive de två som sålts under åren) cirka en miljard 2024, och så sent som 1:a juli startade vi vår senaste verksamhet.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är en glad och optimistisk person som gillar att hugga i – oavsett om det handlar om en knivig ekonomisk uppgift eller att fixa det bästa företagseventet någonsin. Eftersom ekonomi är en servicefunktion för hela koncernen, är servicevilja ett måste för att trivas i rollen, något som präglar hela företaget där vi alla hjälps åt för att bidra till den gemensamma framgången.
 



  





 Tjänsten kan erbjudas deltid såväl som heltid beroende på kandidatens preferenser. 
 



  





 Huvudkontoret är beläget på Sveavägen i centrala Stockholm med tunnelbanestation i samma byggnad som kontoret. 
 



  





 Ekonomiassistenten rapporterar till CFO, och kommer att vara en del av koncernens centrala funktion.
 



   
 



**Arbetsuppgifter:** 




  




* Hantering av löpande bokföring
* Fakturering och leverantörsreskontra
* Avstämningar och rapportering
* Administrativa uppgifter kopplade till ekonomifunktionen



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 




  




* Minst två års erfarenhet av bokföring och ekonomiadministration
* Goda kunskaper i Fortnox (eller jämförbart system) samt Excel/Google Docs
* Noggrann, strukturerad och självständig
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga externt såväl som internt
* Mycket god språklig nivå med flytande svenska



  





**Meriterande:** 




  




* God engelska
* Kunskaper inom marknadsföring
* Arrangera personalaktiviteter, reseplanering
* Snabb på huvudräkning - intresse för matematik och logik
* Vana av att använda AI-verktyg



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 




  




* Flexibla arbetstider
* Fantastiska kollegor
* Möjlighet att arbeta i en innovativ, internationell och växande miljö
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter inom företaget
* Ett familjärt företag med engagerade människor
* Intressanta konferenser
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Ett mycket starkt försäkrings- och pensionspaket



  





**Ansökan** 
 :
 ***Skicka din ansökan med löneförväntningar, CV och ett personligt brev. Motivera gärna varför du tycker att DevCode är en bra match för dig.***




  





*DevCode Group erbjuder högkvalitativa IT-tjänster och driver innovation inom teknikutveckling. DevCode Group består av DevCode Consulting AB, DevCode Identity AB, DevCode Account Control AB, Ledyer AB och Chambersign Sverige AB samt intressebolaget Luminary.* 




  





**Varmt välkommen att bli en del av vårt dynamiska och familjära team på DevCode Group!**

title: Elektriker till Ekerö
description:
Roslagsvatten arbetar fokuserat med att utveckla verksamheten för att säkerställa att kommuninvånarna får den bästa vatten-och avfallsservicen och i förlängningen, möjliggöra hållbara samhällen.
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i mitt i en spännande förbättringsresa – en resa som vi kallar Roslagsvatten 2.0. Våra kommuner växer och utvecklas i hög takt och för att möta morgondagens behov behöver vi ställa om, justera och utveckla vår verksamhet med lösningar som är hållbara över tid.
   

  

 Vårt mål är att vara en av landets främsta VA- och avfallsbolag och genom att agera proaktivt, resultatinriktat, hållbart och med integritet hjälps vi tillsammans åt för att nå våra mål.
   

  

 Till vår enhet Produktion anläggning i Ekerö söker vi nu en elektriker som vill vara med och bidra till vår utveckling.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Enhetens övergripande ansvar är att säkerställa tillgänglighet och driftsäkerhet på våra anläggningar dvs. reningsverk, pumpstationer, tryckstegringsanläggningar, LTA-pumpar och dricksvattenanläggningar.
   

  

 Som elektriker arbetar du självständigt i många olika typer av uppdrag, både i stora projekt och små, korta uppdrag. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter består av att planera, samordna och utföra installationer inom verksamhetens anläggningar. Du genomför installation och montering av elanläggningar samt reparerar och underhåller elinstallationer mm. Arbetet innebär teknisk problemlösning på egen hand men även mycket kontakt med interna beställare, konsulter, kontrollanter och leverantörer. I första hand kommer du att ansvara för installationer på Ekerö men arbete inom Roslagsvattens övriga kommuner kan komma att förekomma.
   

  

 Som elektriker är du delaktig i Roslagsvattens förbättringsarbete och har ett utmanande och ansvarsfullt uppdrag där det ställs höga krav på kvalitet och säkerhet. Du är en del av Produktion anläggning på Ekerö och rapporterar till Platschefen.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* utbildad och certifierad elektriker
* 3-5 års yrkeserfarenhet
* bred kompetens inom installation, felsökning och förebyggande arbete
* B-körkort
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift
* god datorvana och vad att använda olika digitala verktyg
* god administrativ förmåga


 Meriterande
   

  

* allmän behörighet
* erfarenhet av styr- och regler


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Som person är du trygg i din arbetsroll, initiativtagande och van att arbeta självständigt. Du är driven, har ett stort tekniskt intresse och ett strukturerat arbetssätt. Eftersom du i ditt arbete har många kontakter internt och externt, är det viktigt att du är en social person som är bra på att samarbeta och kommunicerar på ett tydligt sätt. I övrigt värdesätter vi att du är en kollega som med vilja och engagemang är med och bidrar till att skapa en säker och trevlig arbetsmiljö tillsammans med dina arbetskamrater.
   

  

 I och med Roslagsvattens satsning på digital utveckling kommer arbetets karaktär att gå mer mot ett IT-styrt underhåll, vilket kommer att ställa krav på inlärning, analytisk förmåga och dokumentation, och för att trivas i denna utveckling tror vi att det är en fördel att du är van att röra dig i den digitala världen.
   

  

**Lön och anställningsvillkor**
 Tillsvidareanställning på heltid, med tillämpning av sex månaders provanställning. Lön enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tillträde: Omgående, enligt överenskommelse, heltid.
   

  

 Arbetstid: kl.07.00-15.45
   

  

 Placering: Bryggavägen 127, Ekerö
   

  

**Kontakt**
 För frågor kring tjänsten kontakta platschef Torkel Andersson på telefon 08-540 835 04 eller e-post; Torkel.Andersson@roslagsvatten.se
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta HR-partner Sarah Mellqvist på 08-598 428 71 eller e-post Sarah.Mellqvist@roslagsvatten.se
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag**
 2024-08-11
   

  

*Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekryteringen. Samtliga av våra inköp sker i enlighet med LOU och för att kunna arbeta med oss så ska man ha varit med i upphandlingen och tecknat ett ramavtal.*

title: Country Sales Manager Sweden
Senior Channel Account Manager, GFI Software (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, GFI Software. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you ready to step into the future of sales and channel management? The channel management industry often grapples with inefficiencies in scaling operations, maintaining consistent growth, and effectively integrating technology to enhance partner interactions. Many companies still rely on traditional methods that lack data-driven decision-making and advanced analytical capabilities.
   

  

 At GFI, we revolutionize this space by integrating Generative AI across all facets of our channel management processes. Our cutting-edge approach not only optimizes operations but also drives sustained revenue growth by enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs. This is an electrifying opportunity to be at the forefront of tech-driven sales innovation, leveraging AI to transform standard practices into dynamic, strategic engagements that deliver measurable results.
   

  

 This role is not your typical channel sales role. You will be expected to master and deploy Generative AI tools, ensuring our partnerships are not just maintained but also optimized and expanded through strategic data-driven methodologies. Your work will involve rigorous partner recruitment, dynamic training sessions, and stringent performance assessments—all enhanced by advanced AI.
   

  

 You'll fit into a team of forward-thinkers where each member is crucial in sculpting the future landscape of channel sales. Your role is pivotal in shaping how partnerships flourish in a tech-driven environment, ensuring both the growth of GFI and our partners. If you are eager to redefine industry standards and possess a robust blend of GenerativeAI proficiency, professional communication, and channel sales management, we encourage you to apply. Join us in transforming the blueprint of channel management and take your place as a leader in a cutting-edge sales revolution.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Partner Recruitment and Onboarding: Identifying, recruiting, and onboarding new partners to expand the channel network. This involves evaluating potential partners' alignment with the company's values and goals, as well as their market reach and capabilities.
* Training and Development: Providing partners with the necessary training and resources to effectively sell and support the product. This includes product training, sales techniques, and ongoing professional development to enhance their capabilities.
* Performance Monitoring and Management: Continuously monitoring the performance of partners against predefined benchmarks and metrics. This includes regular assessment of sales figures, customer feedback, and other performance indicators to identify areas for improvement.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Directly selling to end-user customers
* Prioritizing the quantity of interactions over the quality of your engagements with partners
* Worrying about unpredictable earnings and relentless travel demands


**Senior Channel Account Manager Key Responsibilities**
* Sustained revenue growth from efficiently managing and optimizing a network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs using GenerativeAI tools


**Basic Requirements**
* Professional experience leveraging multiple LLMs (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.) and AI tools to automate manual tasks and boost your company's productivity (if you've only ever used ChatGPT, that's probably not enough)
* 1+ year of indirect channel sales experience in the software industry (direct sales experience does not count)


**About GFI Software**
 GFI Software develops essential applications for small and medium businesses. Over 80,000 customers choose GFI solutions for network management and performance, security, and collaboration applications. GFI Software available through thousands of channel partners dedicated to serving specific countries and regions worldwide.
   

  

 GFI has a fully remote, global workforce. GFI has partnered with Crossover to administer its hiring and global workforce management.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5278-SE-Stockhol-SeniorChannelA.001

title: Renewal Account Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.
   

  

 With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.
   

  

 Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.
   

  

 Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.
   

  

**Job Description**
**What you get to do in this role:**
* Negotiate all facets of renewal contracts. Develop win/win negotiation strategies that maximize contract value while enhancing the customer relationship and the value they are realizing from ServiceNow.
* Identify customer needs and demonstrate account management capabilities to guide renewal closure.
* Maintain an understanding of ServiceNow licensing models to provide both sales and customers assistance in licensing discussions.
* Monitor customer health metrics to identify risks. Develop risk mitigation strategies and guide appropriate actions with partner teams.
* Work with wider team to provide regular and accurate updates on renewal status to management and escalate when needed.
* Engage customer in conversations around renewal readiness, timing and general customer needs.
* Connect with customers on multi-year contracts to ensure continued engagement and customer value realization.
* Present renewal proposal(s) and options to customer and notify customer of upcoming contract expiration.
* Work with Legal, Deals Desk and Sales Operations to resolve complex issues regarding approval and finalization of executable OF.
* Partner with our Customer Success organization to review customer value achievement to achieve customer product adoption and high use.


**Qualifications**
**To be successful in this role you have:**
* 5+ years demonstrated success in a Renewal Account Management or Customer Success capacity.
* Experience leading customer retention and adoption of a SaaS product for complex accounts/territories.
* Advanced proficiency with contract renewal processes.
* Experience building relationships with peers and partners.
* Excellent customer management skills; including sales, account management, and customer service.
* Personal initiative to identify areas of process improvement and efficiency.
* Strong work ethic and quota achievement.
* Deep expertise with a SaaS model focused on enterprise software preferred.


 FD21
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 At ServiceNow, we lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Click here to learn about our work personas: flexible, remote and required-in-office.
   

  

 If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

 For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.
   

  

 Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.
   

  

 From Fortune. © 2022 Fortune Media IP Limited All rights reserved. Used under license.
   

  

 Fortune and Fortune Media IP Limited are not affiliated with, and do not endorse products or services of, ServiceNow.

title: Pega LSA
description:
About the job
 
  





 About Anamata
 



 Anamata is a thriving, international, and prominent player in delivering quality solutions, with a strong focus on low-code platforms like Pega and Mendix. Our mission is to help clients and system integrators to get the most out of their delivery strategies and create high-quality, future-ready applications. We have served clients all over the world and are constantly expanding our scope of work. Due to our growth, we are looking for a Pega Lead System Architect who wants to join our team.
 







 About the position
 



 As a Pega LSA, you will be an all-round Pega professional! You have the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects for different clients. Anamata is known as the Quality-go-to company in the Pega community. This means exciting projects around the world! The projects range from short-term quality awareness scans and subscription services like coaching, architectural reviews and trainings to long-term projects.
 







 You don’t need to have all aspects that we are describing below, because it will be a never-ending journey. We want you to know what to expect from a Pega LSA and describe the characteristics you can achieve while working with us as an Anamateer.
 







 You have knowledge of the entire Pega Software Development Lifecycle (the Pega Express approach). You know how to design or develop complex solutions in Pega, know when to use App Studio and when to use Dev Studio. You have a good understanding of deployment pipelines and a you are able to create them using Deployment Manager. You can work closely with your team members and, if necessary, you are able to assist them. You know how to involve all stakeholders and include and provide them with the right kind of information. Your ultimate goal is to maintain the highest possible quality of Pega application(s) while delivering value fast and first-time right.
 







 You are the person who designs or creates sustainable, future-ready Pega solutions with a quality mindset, providing feedback and proactively thinking of ways to optimize the delivery process.
 







 You have – or will gain – knowledge of the following aspects:
 







 ✦ Defining and continuously optimizing the delivery strategy and way of working for Pega projects
 



 ✦ Designing or Creating and Maintaining Pega Applications
 



 ✦ Monitoring Pega applications
 



 ✦ Advising the team(s) delivery methods and tools, leveraging the right Pega capabilities
 



 ✦ Conducting Pega trainings, onsite and offsite
 



 ✦ Contributing ideas for CI/CD solutions
 



 ✦ Creating and maintaining unit tests
 



 ✦ Perform Quality awareness scans for existing Pega Projects
 







 What do we expect from you?
 



 You have proven experience in Pega projects. You have a critical eye and work with precision. You are analytical, possess excellent communication skills and are a true team player.
 



 Furthermore:
 







 ✦ You have a bachelor or master degree or equivalent work experience and thinking level
 



 ✦ You have your LSA certification
 



 ✦ You are familiar with the latest Pega capabilities (such as Blueprint, Constellation and Pega Express)
 



 ✦ You have experience in designing and developing integrations with other systems
 



 ✦ You are familiar with Agile and Scrum, and you understand that Scrum is a framework
 



 ✦ You have good communication skills in English. Proficiency in the Swedish language is preferred.
 



 ✦ You currently live in Sweden.
 



 ✦ You are creative and see the unknown as a challenge, understanding that there is always more to learn
 







 What do we offer?
 



 At Anamata, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills and knowledge in an innovative environment. You have the opportunity to work for a company, known worldwide for its Quality expertise.
 







 We offer an attractive package of employment benefits, including:
 



 ✦ A salary ranging from €5000 to €7000, depending on experience and skills.
 



 ✦ 26 vacation days per year based on a full-time contract.
 



 ✦ A good pension scheme.
 



 ✦ A mobility allowance
 



 ✦ A study cost reimbursement program.
 



 ✦ A permanent employment contract from the start.
 



 ✦ An excellent bonus scheme.
 



 ✦ Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policy.
 



 ✦ A challenging position within an ambitious company.
 







 Lastly, the role of a LSA highly dynamic. As a certain Forrest G. once said, “Life is like a box of chocolates; you never know what you’re gonna get.”
 



 Therefore, flexibility is important. If you are not afraid to dive into a new project and your sense of humor is as sharp as your Pega skills, then we would love to have you on our team!

title: VIE Coverage Support
company: Societe Generale Corporate and Investment Banking - SGCIB
description:
Reference:
   

  

 24000HXN
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 The Coverage & Investment Banking division of SG CIB, offers a global advisory approach, focused on a strategic dialogue with clients. Building on long-term relationships based on trust, Coverage offers clients the whole range of services offered by SG Group (Global Transaction and Payment Services, Investment Banking, Financial Markets Solutions and other Commercial Banking activities).
   

  

 SG’s Stockholm branch was created to better serve a key clientele consisting of private and public Corporates, Banks, Asset Managers, Insurance Companies and Sovereigns by delivering appropriate solutions from across the SG Group. The V.I.E will work alongside 4 relationship managers (RM) in the coverage department (CORI) within Société Générale’s Corporate & Investment Banking division (SGCIB).
   

  

 In your role as a V.I.E Coverage Support, you will be part of a business and client-driven coverage organization (CORI/COV) and work closely with Senior Bankers, Relationship Managers and the various Sales teams covering Large Nordic Corporate Clients.You will have the opportunity to be involved in internationally renowned transactions and work directly with clients under the supervision of a senior relationship manager. This assignemt offers continued learning opportunities in Market understanding: Get an in-depth view of the Nordic corporate landscape and learn about all the banking products an international bank can offer.
   

  

 Your task and responsibilities include:
   

  

* Participate in the production of business cases to define and enable the bank’s strategy towards key Nordic clients
* Prepare tailored presentations for clients to support senior relationship managers in the business relationship
* Perform profitability calculations in order to advise relationship managers on the impact new deals have on the overall client relationship profitability:
* Calculate key metrics i.e Net Banking Income (NBI), Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA), Regulatory Gross Client Profitability (RGCP), Risk-Adjusted Return On Risk Capital (RARORC) and create sensitivity analysis reports
* Structure and price commercial loans (Term Loan, Revolving Credit Facility)
* Support the coverage team with the objective of expanding SG Stockholm’s client franchise and grow revenues across business lines
* Conduct internal reviews and follow up on client action plans, analyze business potential & cross-selling opportunities, as well as participate in meetings with salespeople to identify opportunities and gaps
* Act as a liaison between teams with different functions from different parts of the bank (e.g. Stockholm, London, Paris)
* Carry ad-hoc analysis on clients & prospects, as well as market/industry trends
* Create Excel reports on Net Banking Income for client portfolios split by e.g. teams, geography, products


**Due to the VIE eligibility criteria, a questionnaire will be provided. Please make sure to answer all the questions for an efficient analysis of your application.**
**Required**
**Profile required**
**PLEASE NOTE that since this program is primarily an international development program, candidates cannot apply to a VIE assignment in their own country of citizenship.**
**To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.**
 Studies & experience:
   

  

* Graduate with a Master’s degree in Finance or Economics from an Engineering School or University with a specialization in Finance, Economics or/and Accounting
* Previous experience in the banking industry is desirable


 Language skills:
   

  

* Fluent in English (B2-C1)
* French or any Nordic language is a plus, but not required


 Technical, operational & soft skills:
   

  

* Knowledge of the European financial environment (in terms of banking regulation, economic trends, markets) is appreciate
* Interest in corporate and investment banking
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office products
* Experience working with and analyzing financial data is preferred
* Excellent analytical & interpretative skills
* Attention to details
* Problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proactive and enthusiastic mindset
* Multitasking skills and ability to prioritize different requests
* Discretion with regards to confidential & sensitive information
* Capacity to work in a fast-paced and demanding environment


**The VIE assignment in a nutshell**
 This VIE in Stockholm is to begin as soon as possible, but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12months.
   

  

 In case a visa is necessary, please make sure your passport is valid up to 6 months after the end of the VIE contract to not delay your departure.
   

  

 The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France’s eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information (including your financial indemnities), please see Mon VIE-VIA Business France.
   

  

**Why join us**
 As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.
   

  

 At the end of your VIE, various opportunities could be offered to you, in France and abroad.
   

  

**Business insight**
 At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.
   

  

 Whether you’re joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.
   

  

 If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!
   

  

**Still hesitating?**
 You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.
   

  

 We are an
 **equal opportunities employer** 
 and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and
 **promoting all talents** 
 , regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

title: Sustainability Associate
description:
*Tele2 is seeking a Sustainability Associate. In this role, you will play a key role in our sustainability efforts, where your contributions will lead to clear results. You will have opportunities to influence decisions and drive meaningful change, making it an ideal position for someone passionate about sustainability and eager to have an impact.*
**About The Job**
 We have the vision to lead in sustainability and have recently been named the most sustainable company in Sweden by Time Magazine. This challenges us every day and holds us accountable. In the role as Sustainability Associate you will be able to take initiative in something that is crucial to our success. You will work closely with Erik who is Head of Sustainability in all matters. One day will be operative and the other you will stand in front of the company’s management team.
   

  

 In this role, you are responsible for a wide variety of assignments that covers the areas of strategy, communication, reporting and ESG ratings. You are managing various implementation projects that will help Tele2 achieve its ambition to lead in sustainability.
   

  

 Responsibilities include:
   

  

* Sustainability reporting: data collection, analysis and project management.
* ESG ratings: data collection, analysis and driving projects to improve Tele2’s results.
* Sustainability strategy analysis and review: ensuring that Tele2’s sustainability strategy is up to date and aligned with stakeholder interests.
* Sustainability strategy project management: running projects to achieve Tele2’s sustainability strategy goals and activities
* Internal communication: writing articles about news and updating sustainability pages for our intranet
* External communication: supporting in writing press releases and creating social media content
* Environmental Management System: implementation, project management and continuous improvements


 Who are you?
   

  

 To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you:
   

  

* have worked 1,5 - 3 years within management, sustainability, finance or PR consulting or in a similar corporate role, but we are gladly challenged with other profiles
* probably have a degree within business, accounting, engineering, communications or similar. A focus or specialization on sustainability is advantageous
* have some experience in project management with the potential of becoming a great project manager
* can do calculations in Excel and to make professional steering group material in Powerpoint
* are fluent in English and Swedish, both written and spoken


 Having experience from internal/external communication, sustainability reporting and/or working with ESG ratings is meriting but not a must.
   

  

**Personal Qualifications**
 Your colleagues describe you as passionate in your work, someone who consistently identifies and takes new initiatives. Listening and communicating are among your strongest tools, and you have the ability to inspire and engage others. You are an exceptional problem solver, with strong analytical skills, and you can always find creative ways to overcome obstacles while always maintaining clear and effective organizational skills.
   

  

 As a person, you are motivated by the opportunity of making our vision to lead in sustainability come true! You have a genuine interest in sustainable business practices and enjoy variety in your work. One day you can do operative sustainability tasks, the next you cand stand in front of a steering group or management team.

title: Site Reliability Engineer - Observability
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*
 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  

 In the middle of the amazing platform that makes up Tink, the SREs of Engineering Foundations provide Tink with tailored self-service tools and services that enable teams to deliver, operate and observe their services, with low friction and entry point. Now we are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Observability team within the Engineering Foundation area. You will be part of the team responsible for maintaining and improving Tink's system's reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your primary focus will be on automating our operations systems and creating a bridge between operations and development.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 As a Site Reliability Engineer in the Engineering Foundations area you will collaborate with many teams internally, encompassing a wide range of technologies. You will be working in an international environment where your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Provide Tink’s engineers with tailored self-service tools and services that enable the teams to deliver, operate and observe their services, with low friction and entry point.
* Look for creative solutions to a scale up's challenges of balancing speed vs quality when building for the future.
* Developing automation and tooling to enable other engineering teams to focus on core business activities.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.
* Being a best practice champion; influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale systems


 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are currently seeking talented individuals to join the observability team, working from our office in central Warsaw or Stockholm.
   

  

 We would like you to have
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer, or similar role in DevOps, Systems Administration, or Software Development.
* Strong understanding of systems, databases, networks, and software engineering.
* Experience with programming languages like Python, Go, or Java.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work as part of a team.
* Ability to participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation.


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

*Who we are at Tink*
*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*
*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*
*We're looking forward to your application!*
 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  

 Tink’s 500+ employees serve more than 300 banks and fintechs in 18 European markets, out of offices in 13 countries. We power the new world of finance. For more information, visit tink.com.

title: Full-time Sales Assistant
description:
We are looking for a Sales Assistant to join our Repair Shop in Jakobsbergsgatan, Stockholm. It's a full-time temporary position, with a start in September 2024. You are expected to work approximately 38,15 hours/week, during both weekdays and weekends. Flexibility in regards to schedule is requested.
   

  

 As a Sales Assistant, you are a part of the retail & e-commerce team. You are responsible for educating and informing customers about our products, policies, and ethos. The aim is to maximize sales and provide the best in class Nudie Jeans customer service.
   

  

**Main responsibilities, but not limited to:**
* Responsible for generating sales and providing excellent customer service.
* Work towards set goals and KPI’s.
* Repair and hemming service.
* Assisting with weekly deliveries.
* Secure that our products are presented according to visual guidelines.
* Maintain an organized stock room and perform stocktakes.
* Manage the POS system and other applications.


**Who you are:**
* Result-oriented and driven by exceeding customer expectations.
* Strong people skills. Easily develops relationships and networks.
* Non-prestigious and has a “can do attitude”.
* Willingness to take charge and help grow the business.
* You get things done, whether it’s on your own or as a member of a team.
* Reliable and punctual.
* Able to work a flexible schedule including weekends.
* Passionate about Nudie Jeans philosophy and our products.


 Our second Repair Shop in Stockholm opened in 2014 in the area of Bibliotekstan at Jakobsbergsgatan 11. It's a large shopping district with exclusive shopping and restaurants with a history of over 120 years. Here you find a selection of our latest collections including jeans, tops, and accessories.
   

  

**Please be aware that we are currently accepting applications for this role. However, due to summer vacations, we will not begin the review process until mid-August. As a result, please anticipate a longer response time.**

title: Learning Designer, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you up-to-date on all the ways AI can revolutionize education? Imagine employing state-of-the-art technology to unlock learning that's more personalized, impactful, and accessible to students. If you have an analytical mind and are passionate about harnessing AI to tackle real-world educational challenges, come see how we’re making it happen.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we're committed to fast-tracking innovation by fusing the latest AI advancements with educational science and human psychology, unlocking unparalleled academic potential. In this role, you will maximize the utility of AI tools to dissect and rebuild the educational experience from the ground up, ensuring every student benefits from truly tailored learning.
   

  

 Engaging deeply with platforms like Quicksight and StudyReel, for example, you'll systematically analyze student performance data and derive actionable insights. The learning opportunities you identify will guide the selection and integration of educational apps and lesson plans. You’ll leverage the latest AI tools and methodologies to develop personalized learning strategies, directly impacting key metrics such as engagement time, lesson comprehension, and test scores.
   

  

 Your work at Trilogy will directly contribute to setting new standards for academic excellence. Apply now and join us in creating a landscape where every student has the tools and opportunities to reach their fullest potential!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Diving deep into performance data to unveil learning gaps, engagement levels, and the effectiveness of current educational tools and content.
* Identifying and integrating cutting-edge educational apps, lesson plans, and tests based on data-driven insights to enhance academic outcomes.
* Harnessing AI and learning science to develop a personalized knowledge base and improve educational strategies in a specific subject.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Making decisions based on intuition; instead, you'll immerse yourself in comprehensive data analysis of student session data, direct student feedback, and other key metrics.
* Isolating yourself in theoretical research; instead, you'll go into “student mode”, taking tests, engaging with apps, and evaluating educational content hands-on.
* Using AI as a buzzword; instead, you’ll get hands-on integrating AI into education to innovate and refine learning strategies, making each educational experience unique and impactful.


**Learning Designer Key Responsibilities**
 Maximize student engagement and academic outcomes by analyzing success metrics, evaluating learning tools, and integrating the latest AI technologies.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* A university degree in any field (preferably in Education, Psychology, or related fields demonstrating a foundational understanding of learning theories, behavioral principles, etc.)
* 3+ years of experience in an EdTech, corporate learning & development, or academic role, with responsibilities such as curriculum development, educational data analysis, digital tool integration, or developing corporate training solutions.
* Practice experience experimenting with Generative AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini) to gain knowledge of prompting techniques and best practices.
* Ability to write simple scripts in any programming language.


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

title: Senior Product Manager - Payments Platform
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*
 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the development of Payments platform powering our One-time-payments and Recurring payments, which are the 2 core payments offering of our full Pay-by-bank proposition.
   

  

**As a Senior Product Manager for Payments Platform you will:** 
  

  

* Build customer expertise:
+ Develop close relationship with customer facing teams and/or the customer itself
+ Identify and crisply define customers problems and needs
+ Serve as an internal and external evangelist for your product, occasionally working with sales and key customers.

* Strategise & Plan:
+ Use customer expertise as the foundation to define and execute the product strategy and roadmap for the payments platform, including setting objectives, key results, and success metrics
+ Conduct cyclical planning process to align product roadmap with business goals, constantly seek adherence with commercial target/business goals and adapt/communicate effectively accordingly

* Prototype, Ship & optimize performance:
+ Drive product development through hypothesis testing
+ Develop detailed product requirements and work closely with engineering to ensure successful delivery
+ Determine and track product performance through metrics and customer feedback

* Go-to-market
+ Work with marketing to define go-to-market strategy, helping to scratch the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer


**Your Profile**
* 5+ years of product management experience at a technology company, creating strategic product roadmap(s) from conception to launch while working with cross-functional teams.
* Previous experience working with payments products is a must
* You are comfortable managing complex technical requirements, such as APIs and other platform components
* You are comfortable redirecting praise towards others and at ease when having to say ‘no’ to stakeholders to preserve the overall vision
* Ability to work cross-functionally, partnering with groups, brokering trade-offs with stakeholders, and understanding their needs.
* Agile, outcome and data-driven.


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

*Who we are at Tink*
*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*
*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*
*We're looking forward to your application!*
 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  

 Tink’s 500+ employees serve more than 300 banks and fintechs in 18 European markets, out of offices in 13 countries. We power the new world of finance. For more information, visit tink.com.
