title: Equipment Electrical Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Electrical Design Engineer with extensive experience in manufacturing equipment design. The ideal candidate will possess a solid understanding of controls and safety standards, ensuring our manufacturing processes are both efficient and safe. This role is crucial to our operations in our state-of-the-art factories across Europe and North America.


Key responsibilities


*Overall areas of responsibility* and activities.


* Lead the effort to set electrical design guidelines for industrial manufacturing equipment, integrating advanced control systems and ensuring compliance with safety standards in Europe, North America, and wherever Northvolt operates.
* Work closely with cross-discipline teams, including Manufacturing Engineering, R&D, Operations, and Maintenance, to understand process requirements, identify automation opportunities, and develop solutions that enhance efficiency, quality, and safety in battery cell manufacturing.
* Conduct risk assessments, safety analyses, and validation testing to ensure the reliability, safety, and performance of automation systems in manufacturing environments, adhering to regulatory requirements and industry standards.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior engineers and technicians in automation design and troubleshooting, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the Automation team.
* Support new product introductions, capacity expansions, and process improvements by collaborating with cross-discipline teams to implement solutions that meet business objectives and drive operational excellence.
Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in automation engineering and apply them to optimize manufacturing processes and equipment.  
* 

Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Full time employment, fixed salary, and base location is Västerås.


Planned starting date asap.


*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*


Skills & Requirements


Qualifications and experience


* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Controls Engineering, or related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications are a plus.
* Minimum of 8 years of experience in electrical design engineering, with a focus on manufacturing equipment design.
* Proficiency in CAD software for electrical and mechanical design, including creating schematics, layouts, and equipment drawings (e.g., AutoCAD Electrical, EPLAN).
* Knowledge of safety standards (e.g., ANSI, NFPA), risk assessment methodologies (e.g., FMEA, HAZOP), and regulatory requirements (e.g., OSHA, NEC) for automation systems in manufacturing.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong communication, collaboration, and project management skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-discipline teams and external partners.
* Passion for clean energy technologies, sustainability, and innovation in manufacturing.
Great Place to Work


World leading technique


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Warrant program


Wellness grant
company_description: Northvolt is a supplier of sustainable, high-quality batteries. The mission is to build the world’s greenest battery, with minimal carbon footprint and the highest ambitions for recycling

title: Data scientist/Machine learning engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Do you also want to make the world a little better while devoting yourself to cutting-edge technology development? Then Sigma Industry Development is the right company for you.



As a data scientist/machine learning engineer at Sigma Industry Development, you will:


* Design solutions for distributed computing to handle large datasets
* Develop domain expertise to better understand business problems and provide relevant solutions for the organization/client
* Creating clear and effective visualizations to present findings through visualizations and reports to non-technical stakeholders; communicating complex findings in a clear and understandable manner
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, engineers, and decision-makers
* Applying critical thinking to frame and solve complex problems
* Adopting an iterative approach to problem-solving, refining models based on feedback
* Understanding and adhering to data privacy and ethical considerations
* Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance


And remember – besides the unlimited possibilities to engineer cutting-edge technology, you're an addition to our team; you become an integral part of the Sigma family, weaving your unique thread into the intricate tapestry of our company's path forward. Your presence holds the potential to shape our collective journey, infusing it with your skills and perspectives.



Welcome to the Sigma family. Your journey starts now, where each line of code etches a mark of your contribution on the canvas of our collective ambition.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**





**Education**



* B.Sc. or M.Sc in Computer Science or Applied Physics/Mathematics


**Know-how**



* Data Analysis - Proficient in exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data patterns and trends.
* Statistical Modeling - Designing and implementing statistical models to derive insights from data.
* Hypothesis Testing - Conducting hypothesis testing to validate assumptions and make data-driven decisions.
* Programming Languages - Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis; developing predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes.
* Data Cleaning and Preprocessing - Cleaning and preprocessing raw data to prepare it for analysis.
* Data Wrangling - Manipulating and transforming data into a suitable format for analysis.
* Machine Learning and algorithm Selection - Selecting appropriate machine learning algorithms based on the nature of the problem.
* Model Evaluation - Evaluating model performance using metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score
* Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance
* Hyperparameter Tuning - Optimizing model hyperparameters for better performance
* Big Data Technologies - Familiarity with big data processing tools like Hadoop and Apache Spark
* SQL and NoSQL Databases - Proficiency in working with both SQL (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB) databases.


**Linguistics**



* Swedish and English (spoken and written)

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



You embody the spirit of a passionate team player, adept at fostering positive interactions through exceptional soft skills. What sets you apart is your unwavering enthusiasm for both professional growth and enjoyment in the process. Just as we do, you believe that learning should be a journey of discovery and excitement.



If the realm of AI holds a special place in your interests, consider it an added advantage. We're thrilled at the prospect of delving into the world of artificial intelligence alongside you. Together, we'll nurture and cultivate these skills, turning curiosity into expertise, and evolving with the ever-changing landscape of technology.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry Development offers you a platform to shape your future. A company where you can excel in your career and simultaneously contribute to the greater good.



**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – a selection**



* https://starforlife.org/
* https://expectabettertomorrow.com/
* https://www.parasport.se/
* https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council

**Our core values are**



* Family identity – have fun together and show appreciation.
* Teamplay – engage, learn, and give feedback.
* Gender equality & equal treatment – we are all the same: humans.
* Action – act to excel.


**In addition, Sigma offers a range of benefits**



* TGL Group Life Insurance
* Cellphone and subscription
* Additional life & accidents insurance
* Occupational Pension scheme
* Parental salary subsidy
* Wellness contribution
* Flexible working hours
* Hybrid workplace


Apply today if you like to know more about Sigma Industry Development.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



To apply – Register your resume via our website (link in add). The recruitment process is continuously ongoing.



For further information please contact, Oscar Silversparf (oscar.silversparf@sigma.se).


* #### **POSITION**


Data scientist/Machine learning engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Development
* #### **LOCATION**


Stockholm, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Testing and Verification, System design, Business Intelligence, Business Systems, System development, Business Analysis, Software development
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-07-01
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2024-07-31
* #### **CONTACT**


Oscar Silversparf, oscar.silversparf@sigma.se, +46702092226

Upper Saddle River, NJ 07458

title: Sr. Frontend Engineer (Onsite) for Portfolio Brands
description:
**Company Description**
 Join our innovative team in Portfolio Brands in Stockholm where we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional online shopping experiences as we are looking for
 **Senior Frontend Engineer** 
 .
   

  

 We are on a journey to implement latest innovative solutions, offering seamless navigation, personalized recommendations, and an immersive browsing experience. We leverage advanced technologies to ensure a fast, secure, and user-friendly interface, allowing customers to explore our curated collections effortlessly. Our commitment to excellence drives us to continuously enhance our digital storefront and ensuring that our customers experience an exceptional online shopping journey.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Develop and maintain high-quality responsive web applications.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including designers, backend developers, and product managers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement.
* Drive initiatives with CoP(Community of Practises), sharing knowledge and collective growth.
* Contribute to architechtural decisions and technical roadmap planning.
* Work closely with stakeholders from all parts of the organization to develop the technical aspects of prioritized business projects.
* Ensure engineering excellence through customer centricity, rigorous testing, innovative solutions, and adherence to best practices in software development.
* Work-in and follow Agile methodologies.
* Learn, grow, be challenged, and have fun!


**Qualifications**
* At least 5+ years experience working as a software engineer with strong frontend focus.
* Extensive experience in frontend development, particularly with React, Nextjs and Typescript.
* Strong understanding of modern frontend architectures and best practices.
* Proficiency in frontend build tools and package managers such as Webpack, Babel, or npm.
* Interest and experience in mentoring a team of developers.
* Collaborate with backend, data, analytics and designer teams to create seamless user experiences.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.
* Working in CMS tool is desired.
* Knowledge in tailwind is an advantage.
* Good to have knowledge in Nodejs.
* Staying updated on emerging technology trends like API strategy, event-driven architecture, and cloud computing to contribute effectively to evolving technology strategies.
* Fluency in English as it is the working language at H&M Group.


**Additional Information**
 For this position, we are primarily looking for candidates located in and around the Stockholm region to work in our
 **office in Liljeholmen.**
 Benefits at H&M Group:
   

  

* 5-6 weeks time off yearly and good work-life balance
* Special discount for our employees in all H&M stores and online worldwide.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market
* Lots of additional perks and discounts from Benify for health and wellbeing
* Ample of focus groups to celebrate diversity and inclusiveness as well as our international culture and events.


**Are you the person we are looking for?** 
 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.
   

  

 Questions about this recruitment process can be answered by Lead TA Partner - Nidhi Illman via nidhi.illman@hm.com
   

  

 Please stick to applying only via our SmartRecruiters system as due to GDPR, we dont accept applications via LinkedIn message or emails.

title: Embedded Systems Engineer
description:
**About Us:** 




 NAD is a cutting-edge defense startup on a mission to redefine aerial defense technologies. We develop an innovative electric-powered counter-UAV system designed to address the rapidly evolving threats posed by unmanned aerial vehicles. We're on the hunt for a skilled Embedded Systems Engineer to join our interdisciplinary and international team in Stockholm.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 As an Embedded Systems Engineer, you will play a key role in defining, designing, developing and testing our counter-UAV systems. You likely have a background in electrical engineering and can take a birds eye view - from schematics, simulation and PCB design, to coding, testing, and debugging system software for embedded devices and systems. Preferably you have a background in defense, aviation or other related industries.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design schematics and PCBs - including components selection, simulation, etc.
* Write and maintain robust, efficient, and secure embedded software.
* Assist in drafting system requirements, test plans, diagnostic tools, and validating software.
* Assist in preparing systems and products for large-scale production and assembly.
* Collaborate with other engineers and team members to integrate various system components.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to enhance system capabilities.



  





**Requirements (core):** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. A PhD is considered a plus.
* Background in defense, aviation or a related field.
* Proven experience in embedded systems design and development.
* Strong proficiency in design of schematics, PCB, and electronic circuit simulation.
* Expertise in Python, C/C++, OpenCL with experience with RTOS (µC/OS, freeRTOS).
* Proficiency with Git and Visual Studio Code (VSCode).
* Strong mathematical and analytical ability with excellent problem-solving skills.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken. Additional languages are a plus.
* Eligibility for security clearance, as required by defense industry regulations.



  





**Requirements (preferred):** 



* Knowledge of image processing techniques and real-time vision systems.
* Knowledge of RF, radars and lasers.
* Knowledge of power electronics, motor controls and battery technology.
* Knowledge of flight tests, drones and R/C aircrafts, including hands-on experience.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* The opportunity to work on groundbreaking defense technology.
* A chance to make a difference in national and global security.
* A dynamic and supportive team environment that fosters innovation and creativity.
* Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options.
* Professional development opportunities and a chance to grow with a rapidly expanding startup.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. As a consultant with us, you'll enjoy a high salary, a generous benefits package, and the opportunity to work remotely. On average, our consultants increase their monthly pay by 44%. How is this possible?
   

  

 The math is simple. We can pay you more because we cut costs on things that don't directly benefit you - no overpaid bosses, no expensive group conferences, and no big fancy offices. Instead, we invest in you, providing the trust and freedom you need to excel and compensating you accordingly. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

 Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody means:
   

  

* Maxed out compensation. Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Higher sense of freedom. No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who want.
* Shaping the future. Work with digital game-changers like Mojang, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, and various startups and scale-ups.


**About Us**
 Coody is a dynamic and growing team for the new generation in tech, with assignments in Sweden, Finland, and the UK. Our broad network includes customers in Gaming, AI, XR/VR, EV, MedTech, and FinTech sectors.
   

  

 We like to think of ourselves as a community platform rather than a company. We are building a seamless existence for our consultants where trust is high and micro-management is low. We cherry-picked the functions that actually benefit consultants and are proud to share our benefits stated in our employee handbook.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a consultant in Embedded Software Engineering at Coody you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.
   

  

 You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute to areas such as; developing robust software applications in real-time systems, working methods, product strategy, technical environment and team spirit.
   

  

 You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience working as an Embedded Software Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more common technical areas such as: C, C++, Python, Rust, RTOS, Linux, Embedded Android, CANbus, QT, microcontrollers, hardware, and communication interfaces
* Experience working in an agile environment
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done
* A current Swedish citizenship or working visa that allows you to work in Sweden
* An Engineering degree focusing on vehicle/electro/machine/electronics or computer technology/ Degree in computer science or mechatronics


 If Gravity Free Consulting sounds like the perfect fit for you and your profile matches our needs, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We will respond within a week if your profile aligns with our current requirements.

title: Junior Linux Kernel Engineer - Ubuntu
description:
Every year we select new junior professionals into the Canonical kernel team, to work on the Linux kernel for Ubuntu. If you've enjoyed operating systems in your coursework or current role, you are confident in your ability to write high quality C and possibly Rust, and are ready to take the plunge and see how it all works, then this would be a great place to pursue your next career stage. We are a global team working to ship the world's most widely used Linux kernel, across the very latest silicon and cloud, where you can apply and grow your software engineering skills.
   

  

 The Canonical Kernel Team builds and maintains all supported Ubuntu Linux kernels for a variety of platforms and architectures from small embedded devices to standard desktop/server systems to large-scale cloud environments. In your first year you will tackle serious initiatives, which include but are not limited to:
   

  

* Optimized solutions for key Silicon and Cloud partner platforms
* Developer platforms such as Raspberry Pi and RISC-V
* Enabling Ubuntu on a wide range of embedded systems
* Security hardening and exploit mitigation
* Third-party driver integration and distribution, such as graphics
* Expanded driver support for bleeding-edge PC platforms


 We select candidates that are recent university graduates or early career professionals who are enthusiastic to develop kernel-level software in multiple areas including security updates, patching, and testing. The successful candidate will have a background in software engineering, be motivated to work in a distributed team and willing and able to travel globally twice a year for company engineering events.
   

  

 These are full-time positions available to prospective or recently graduated students.
   

  

**Location:** 
 We have home-based kernel teams in every timezone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team
* Learn from senior mentors to demystify the inner workings of the Linux kernel and how it is distributed
* Work closely with external silicon, cloud, or hardware manufacturer delivery teams on bleeding-edge platforms
* Diagnose and resolve issues in the kernel reported by customers, the community, and discovered by your own rigorous testing
* Take personal responsibility for the delivery of various flavors of the Ubuntu Linux kernel
* Improve tooling and automation for delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels
* Submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Well-organized and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment
* Professional manner with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
* Programming experience in C and/or Rust
* Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git
* Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals
* Ability to travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks length


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Interest and experience in Rust
* Python and Bash scripting ability
* Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging
* Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging
* Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Home-based work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Engineer | Shared Tech
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We’re looking for a self-starting and enthusiastic Data Engineer with a focus on data platforms and tooling to join our team.
   

  

 With over 16 Petabytes of data and over 130 billion events generated every day, data at King is at the heart of the business. The Data & ML organisation at King - split across Barcelona, London and Stockholm - is responsible for ingesting and processing all the data we receive each day and to use it to drive all of King's data, analytics and machine learning needs.
   

  

 You will be part of the
 *Data Foundations* 
 team, in charge of providing data products and services used by the whole company. You’ll take ownership and accountability of projects, spot opportunities for technical and platform improvements, and drive our data systems to the next level.
   

  

****Your role within our Kingdom:****
* You will work in a highly collaborative team to devise solutions to data systems, tooling and engineering problems, bringing your skills and ideas into every discussion.
* Develop, operate and maintain components of our data platform including our Airflow based orchestration platform and framework (450k tasks per week), our data catalog and our proprietary data notification system built with python, GCP pub/sub and GCP datastore.
* You’ll take ownership and responsibility for the quality of the solutions, testing them and ensuring best practices are used throughout the development process - particularly with regard to self-explanatory code, maintainability, cost efficiency and scalability.
* You’ll learn new technical skills when needed and use them to help the team achieve success.
* Use your expertise in Python to build out our Airflow framework, enhance our data notification system and contribute to the wider python community and ecosystem.
* You will collaborate with other teams within the Shared Tech organisation to ensure the consistent and coherent growth of our collective data capabilities.
* You will engage directly with our stakeholders to understand the way they work and their problems.
* Champion data literacy and engineering best practice with our stakeholders and wider cross functional teams, and share your knowledge with King’s Data Engineering craft.


****Skills to create thrills:****
* Expertise in Python, including application frameworks (Flask, FastAPI), pytest, TDD, API design and pydantic.
* In-depth knowledge of Airflow components, architecture, and best practices in DAG development, including advanced topics like DAG factories.
* Proven experience with GCP, AWS or Azure.
* Experience working with Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with BigQuery or similar cloud DWH platforms such as Snowflake or AWS Redshift.


****Bonus skills:****
* SQL and data modeling.
* Exposure to Kubernetes, Helm, Docker.
* BI tools such as Looker/PowerBI/etc.
* GCP based services such as cloud run, datastore, dataflow, cloud functions and pub/sub.
* ML Ops knowledge and grasp of basic concepts.


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Engineer - Data/Analysplattform
description:
*Med ca 2 miljoner kunder och störst andel av alla avslut på Stockholmsbörsen har vi en hel del data som måste hanteras. I rollen som Data Engineer med fokus på Java, Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery och dbt blir du en viktig del i att utveckla tekniken för att möjliggöra vår vision att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor!* 




  





**\*Under sommaren kan återkoppling dröja längre än vanligt, urvalsarbetet kommer påbörjas senast V.33.\*** 




  





**Om teamet och rollen:** 




 Hos oss har teamen stark autonomi i att välja teknik för plattformen och dess utveckling. Vi jobbar tillsammans för att ständigt förbättra arkitekturen, funktionaliteten och teamets effektivitet och välmående, allt för att på bästa möjliga sätt kunna skapa värde från stora mängder data.
 



  





 En data engineer i vårt team förstår värdet i att ta in utvecklartänket i dataområdet. Det innebär versionshantering, testning och att se data som en produkt. Det gäller även att, med DevOps-tänk i ryggraden, kunna utveckla modern infrastruktur i molnet och hur den kan knytas till befintliga strukturer på ett säkert sätt.
 



  





 I dataplattformsteamet är det väsentligt att ha djup förståelse för både den centrala tekniken och användarupplevelsen på plattformen. Vi arbetar ständigt för att förstå hur vi kan minska utvecklare och andra kollegors kognitiva last och effektivisera plattformen. Det ska vara enkelt att bygga kundvärde på Avanza!
 



  





 Vi utvecklar kontinuerligt plattformen så att den blir mer strömlinjeformad, säker och automatiserad. Det är hög innovationstakt inom datavärlden och detta ger oss möjligheten att bygga bättre och häftigare lösningar kontinuerligt. Vi hoppas du vill följa med oss på denna roliga resa framåt!
 



  





**Hos oss kommer du:** 



* Sätta ramarna för dataprodukter i dbt, BigQuery, Docker, Python och andra verktyg
* Javautveckling för integrering med Avanzas backend-appar via Kafka
* Jobba med verktyg så som Terraform på GCP
* Ta fram verktyg för effektiva förädlingsflöden och datapipelines
* Arbeta med säkerhet och behörigheter för data
* Utbilda kollegor i tekniker och arkitektur



  





**Din profil:** 




 En data engineer i vårt team förstår vikten av samarbete och värdet i att vara service minded då våra kunder är Avanzas egna utvecklingsteam, det betyder coachning och support runt dataförädling inom kundteamens egna domäner. Teamet driver även autonomt många av sina projekt och för att trivas i rollen behöver du våga att testa och trivas i att driva dina initiativ framåt.
 



  





**Vi tror du:** 



* Är erfaren och kunnig inom systemutveckling i Java
* Erfarenhet av AWS, GCP eller liknande molnmiljö
* Har kunskap inom modern infrastruktur och DevOps (CI/CD, Testautomatisering) och relaterated verktyg så som Terraform och Docker
* Är väl förtrogen med en data engineers verktygslåda (t ex Python, SQL, dbt, Airflow, Prefect eller Great Expectations)
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift



  





**Det är meriterande om du:** 



* Deltagit i ML- eller ML-Ops-projekt
* Har erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhet



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den
 **11** 
**Augusti** 
 . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
Stockholm Exergi är stockholmarnas energibolag och vi är ca 750 medarbetare som varje dag arbetar för att minska stockholmarnas klimatpåverkan. Vi värmer över 800 000 stockholmare och vårt 300 mil långa fjärrvärmenät är navet för de samhällsnyttor som vi skapar. Vi planerar att bygga en anläggning för koldioxidinfångning vid vårt biokraftvärmeverk i Värtan med potential att fånga in 800 000 ton koldioxid per år, vilket är mer än Stockholms vägtrafik släpper ut under samma period.
   

  

 Vi behöver fler duktiga medarbetare och hoppas att du vill vara med oss på vår Exergiresa.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 Som Data Engineer i vårt team hanterar du tillsammans med dina kollegor helheten runt Data & Analytics på Stockholm Exergi. Vi letar efter dig som lockas av idén att jobba med modern teknologi och att skapa bestående värden för våra intressenter. Vi söker dig som vill ha en nyckelroll i att skapa automatiserade arbetsflöden och pipelines för att hämta, organisera och transformera data från olika källor. Vi är idagsläget i ett stadie där vi utvecklar och etablerar en ny dataplattform på MS Azure och Databricks.Som en del av teamet inom Data & Analytics skapar du förutsättningar för dataanalytiker och maskininlärningsingenjörer att bygga stabila analyslösningar- genom att se till att data finns på rätt plats, i rätt format och i rätt tid, korrekt modellerad och tillgängligt i bland annat Power BI. För den här rollen ser vi att du har god teknisk erfarenhet i dataplattformar, liksom en vana att hantera affärskrav och kommunicera med användare.
   

  

 Rollen är en tillsvidareanställning och har sin utgångspunkt i Hjorthagen, Stockholm. Möjlighet till viss distansarbete finns.
   

  

**Varför jobba med mig?**
 Jag tycker om att arbeta på Stockholm Exergi och vill vara med i arbetet mot en hållbar stad. Min prioritet är att det ska kännas schysst att gå till jobbet och att alla får möjlighet att vara den bästa versionen av sig själva. Som person är jag engagerad, transparent och brinner för att få saker gjorda. Jag tror på att arbeta tillsammans, vara prestigelös och se till allas bästa. Tillsammans strävar vi efter att inte bara uppnå höga prestationer utan också att säkerställa ett hållbart arbetsliv för alla.
   

  

 Jag uppskattar att arbeta med personer som är lösningsorienterade, organiserade, kommunikativa och positiva.
   

  

 Annika Wallgren, Head of Business Solutions
   

  

**Vem är du som person?**
 Alla som jobbar hos oss måste vara nyfikna, ta initiativ och ansvar. För just den här rollen bör du vara en social person med en positiv inställning. Du kan jobba självständigt men trivs också med att arbete i grupp och har goda presentations- och kommunikationsfärdigheter. Vi ser gärna att du har ett stort leveransfokus och alltid strävar efter hög kvalitet. Vi värdesätter både tekniskt kunnande och god samarbetsförmåga. Ett intresse för att effektivisera och digitalisera verksamheter är något vi uppskattar.
   

  

**Krav**
* Akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande utbildning i komination med för rollen relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete som Data Engineer eller motsvarande
* Goda kunskaper inom Databricks
* Goda kunskaper inom Power BI
* Goda kunskaper inom datamodellering
* Goda kunskaper inom Python
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure, inkl. Azure Data Factory


**Nyfiken på oss eller våra anläggningar?**
 – Det är en blandning av strategiskt och operativt arbete, där jag får tala både med kunder om vad som är bra och vad som kan bli bättre och med utvecklare om hur vi kan lösa det. Det allra roligaste är att få höra av mig tillbaka till kunder som har hjälpt till med feedback i utvecklingen och berätta om att vi har löst det de önskat sig säger Camilla, systemägare
   

  

 Vi är fler kollegor som gärna vill ge en inblick i vårt arbete. Läs våra berättelser här.
   

  

 Två av våra anläggningar kan du dessutom besöka virtuellt. Gå in på stockholmexergi.se/virtuell-vartaverket eller stockholmexergi.se/virtuell-bristaverket. Det fungerar i både dator och mobil.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
* Mer nyfiken på hur rekryteringsprocessen går till? Läs mer här.
* Vi behandlar dina personuppgifter för att kunna genomföra rekryteringsprocessen korrekt och effektivt. Läs mer här .
* Inför anställning till Stockholm Exergi genomför vi alltid bakgrundskontroll. Läs mer här .
* Vi arbetar för att främja mångfald och inkludering, inte minst när vi rekryterar. Läs mer här .
* Vill du läsa mer om fackklubbar vid Stockholm Exergi? Läs mer här.
* För frågor om tjänsten, se kontaktuppgift till rekryterande chef nedan. Frågor om rekryteringsprocessen får du gärna mejla till rekrytering@stockholmexergi.se.


 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 31 juli. Urval och intervjuer sker med hänsyn till sommarledighet.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
*Are you passionate about harnessing the power of GPUs to drive cutting-edge advancements in software development?* 




*Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where innovation and creativity are valued?* 




*If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!* 




  





  





**ABOUT THE COMPANY** 




 The company are at the forefront of software development, working with some of the most advanced products in the industry. Their collaborative team of experienced developers embraces an open mindset, working together to solve challenges and push the boundaries of what's possible. They foster innovation, encouraging development and exploring new paths to problem-solving. Join them, and you'll be part of a dynamic environment where you're challenged to enhance quality and contribute innovative solutions.
 



  





  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated GPU Software Developer to join the team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing high-performance GPU-accelerated software solutions using CUDA programming. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that leverage the power of GPUs to solve complex computational problems across various domains.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities include:** 



* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement GPU-accelerated algorithms and applications.
* Optimize existing software for GPU architectures to maximize performance and efficiency.
* Conduct research and development to explore new techniques and technologies in GPU computing.
* Perform code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure high-quality deliverables.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in GPU technology and CUDA programming.



  





  





**QUALIFICATIONS** 



* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Minimum 2 years working experience in relevant field
* Strong proficiency in CUDA programming and GPU architecture.
* Solid understanding of parallel programming concepts and techniques.
* Experience with performance profiling and optimization of GPU-accelerated applications.
* Proficiency in C/C++ programming languages.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Experience with other GPU programming frameworks such as OpenCL or Vulkan.
* Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Knowledge of computer graphics principles and APIs (e.g., OpenGL, DirectX).
* Experience with software development in Linux environments.



  





 If you're ready to take your career to the next level and be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of technology, we want to hear from you! Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and why you're the perfect fit for this role.
 



  





**OTHER INFORMATION:** 




**Start:** 
 as per agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Mandatory at least 60% in the Täby office
 



**Employment:** 
 This is a consultancy role with the possibility to get a direct employment with the company after 6 months

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
This is a remote position.
   

  

 we are at the forefront of innovation, transforming from a traditional data management approach to a modern, streamlined data ecosystem. We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team. This role is critical in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure to ensure the integrity, accessibility, and quality of our data assets.
   

  

 As a Data Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing and optimizing our data pipelines and storage solutions. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts, users, and other stakeholders to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, useful, and efficiently processed.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
* Implement and optimize data storage solutions in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to improve data processing and analysis workflows.
* Participate in data migration projects, including the transition from legacy systems to modern platforms.
* Provide support for data-related issues and assist in troubleshooting.


**Requirements**
**Must-Have Qualifications:**
**AWS Cloud Management:**
* Knowledge of troubleshooting a cloud environment using tools such as Cloudwatch and Cloudtrail.
* Cloud monitoring skills including, but not limited to, Cloudwatch Insights, Alarms, Security Hub, Trusted Advisor, and Cost Management.


**Kubernetes (EKS):**
* Monitor and troubleshoot Kubernetes environments to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
* Maintenance such as updating the EKS engine and (re)deploying.


**Infrastructure as Code (IaC):**
* Develop, test, and maintain infrastructure automation scripts using Terraform.


**Networking:**
* Monitor and optimize network performance and troubleshoot connectivity issues.


**Good-to-Have Knowledge of:**
**AWS Cloud Management:**
* Develop and enforce Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies for user and role-based access control.
* Utilize Key Management Service (KMS) for managing cryptographic keys and ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
* Implement and manage SSL/TLS certificates using AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) for secure communications.
* Working knowledge of ETL processes using AWS Glue for data integration and transformation.


**Kubernetes (EKS):**
* Create and maintain Helm charts for application deployment and configuration management.
* Implement Kubernetes best practices for resource allocation, scaling, and management.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC):
* Ensure infrastructure changes are reviewed, tested, and deployed in a controlled and automated manner.
* IT Security:
* Implement and enforce security best practices across all layers of the IT infrastructure.
* Conduct or initiate regular security assessments, vulnerability scans, and penetration tests.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional level preferred.
* Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) or Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD).
* Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or AWS CodePipeline.

title: Tableau-developer to tech-company!
description:
Do you want to be part of a modern employer that cares about its employees? At our client, a sustainable work life is a priority and they offers teamwork, strong customer focus, and technical challenges. Does this sound like you? Apply now!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, during a 6 month period, with possibility to extension
 



  

**Start date :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 The responsibilities include managing, further developing, and creating new reports and data sources in Tableau Desktop in collaboration with our clients existing Tableau developers and data warehouse team. It also involves managing Tableau Server, enhancing automation for Tableau Server for tasks such as extract loading and publishing using PowerShell, and providing user support on handling, interpretation, and statistics.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Flexible working hours
  
* A healthy corporate culture focused on sustainability in the workplace and the value of doing your best
  
* A fixed monthly salary through Academic Work and new, modern offices at Skanstull
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Active management of Tableau Server and its content.
  
* Development of reports and data sources in Tableau Desktop.
  
* Interpret business requirements into appropriate implementations and provide feedback on requirements.
  
* Drive improvement proposals for the delivery of statistics to unemployment insurance funds on both large and small scales.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Extensive experience with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server. (This skill needs to be clear in your resumé)
  
* Development of complex metrics.
  
* Performance optimization for loading times.
  
* PowerShell.
  
* Experience using tabcmd and tsm for scripting jobs in Tableau Server.
  
* Knowledge of various Tableau APIs.
  
* Experience with Tableau’s PostgreSQL database.
  
* Proficiency in spoken and written English.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience with ReqTest and Jira
  
* Proficiency in spoken and written Swedish is a plus, since many clients are Swedish-speaking
  


  


 \_\_A requirement to move forward in this process is to have great experience and knowledge within Tableau. This experience needs to be clarified in your resumé. \_\_
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Fanny Steisjö or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on fanny.steisjo@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105789
